body:
1. cimChildJobBase.cs

_sleepAndRetryTimer.Dispose() is called in StopJob() and last one is called in Dispose(). So we can suppress the case.

2. Process.cs

_outputWriter.Dispose(); is called in exit handler StreamClosing(). So we can suppress the case.

3. WebCmdlet/StreamHelper.cs

_originalStreamToProxy is never disposed. Web cmdlets write the object to Pipeline.  It is seem we could document this and recommend users to explicitly dispose the class if they need to free resources.

4. XmlCommands.cs

 XmlReader _xr is never disposed. It is seem a bug.

6. ConsoleHost.cs

It seems ConsoleHost i is not responsible for current  pipeline (runningCmd) but remoteRunspace is. No bug.

5. ConsoleHost.cs

ConsoleTextWriter _consoleWriter is never disposed. ConsoleHost has Dispose method. It is seem a bug.

7. BaseCommand.cs

Dispose(); calls in InternalDispose(). So no bug. But perhaps we could use a standard pattern.

8. CommandSearcher.cs

_matchingCmdlet should be in Dispose(). It is a bug.

9. CommandSearcher.cs

_pathSearcher is in Dispose(). I wonder why it is alarmed.

10. CommandSearcher.cs

_matchingAlias should be in Dispose(). It is a bug.

11. CommandSearcher.cs

_matchingFunctionEnumerator should be in Dispose(). It is a bug.

12. DscResourceSearcher.cs

_matchingResource = null in Reset() and the Reset is called from Dispose(). It is a bug (we should dispose in Reset()).

13. InternalCommands.cs

I guess PSTaskChildJob-s  from _taskJob are disposed in ThreadPool but _taskJob itself is never disposed. I think it is bug.

14. MshCommandRuntime.cs

AllowWrite is not owner of the PipelineProcessor. No bug.

15. PSClassSearcher.cs

_matchingClass = null in Reset() and the Reset is called from Dispose(). It is a bug (we should dispose in Reset()).

16. debugger.cs

It seems we could remove _psDebuggerCommand at all - it is used only once in `using` statement. Or is there async?

17. ConnectionBase.cs

RunspaceOpening  is disposed in LocalConnection.Dispose(). It is not a bug but we could refactor code so that dispose in RunspaceBase.

18. ConnectionBase.cs

ConnectionBase is not an owner of _currentlyRunningPipeline. It is not a bug. Yes?

19. PowerShell.cs

It seems PowerShell is not an owner of the _runspacePool.  So no bug.

20. Job.cs

PSRemotingChildJob is not an owner of the _runspacePool. So no bug.

21. Job2.cs

ContainerParentJob should dispose _tracer (Dispose() already is). It is a bug.

22. remoterunspace.cs

RemoteRunspace is not an owner of the _currentInvokeCommand. So no bug.

23. remoterunspace.cs

It seems we could remove _psDebuggerCommand at all - it is used only once in `using` statement. Or is there async?

24. InvokeCommandCommand.cs

Invoke-Command calls _steppablePipeline.End() in EndProcessing() where Dispose() is called. So we can suppress the case.

25. ReceiveJob.cs

_tracer should be disposed in ReceiveJobCommand.Dispose(). It is a bug.

26. VSocket.cs

_tracer should be disposed in RemoteSessionHyperVSocketServer.Dispose(). It is a bug.

27. VSocket.cs

_tracer should be disposed in RemoteSessionHyperVSocketClient.Dispose(). It is a bug.

28. RemoteSessionNamedPipe.cs

_tracer should be disposed in RemoteSessionNamedPipeServer.Dispose(). It is a bug.

29. RemoteSessionNamedPipe.cs

_tracer should be disposed in NamedPipeClientBase.Dispose(). It is a bug.

30. OutOfProcTransportManager.cs

_tracer should be disposed in OutOfProcessClientSessionTransportManagerBase.Dispose(). It is a bug.

31. OutOfProcTransportManager.cs

_tracer should be disposed in SSHClientSessionTransportManager.Dispose(). It is a bug.

32. ObjectReader.cs

_enumerator should be disposed in PSDataCollectionReader<T, TResult>.Dispose(). It is a bug.

WG-Engine discussed this today.

We agree that any valid violation of this rule should be fixed. Leaving as up for grabs.
